祭.definition: to offer a sacrifice to (gods or ancestors); (in classical novels) to recite an incantation to activate a magic weapon; to wield (sth magic); (bound form) ceremony; (Tw) (bound form) (celebratory) festival

祭出.definition: to brandish (a figurative weapon, i.e. some measure intended to deal with the situation); to resort to (some tactic)

祭奠.definition: to offer sacrifices (to one's ancestors); to hold or attend a memorial service

祭灶.definition: to offer sacrifices to the kitchen god

祭祀.definition: to offer sacrifices to the gods or ancestors

祭祖.definition: to offer sacrifices to one's ancestors

祭酒.definition: to offer a libation; person who performs the libation before a banquet; senior member of a profession; important government post in imperial China
